title: WCAS HISTORY 405-0-20 Seminar in Historical Analysis

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course will introduce students to recent and not-quite-so-recent works in environmental history. These works demonstrate the way that environmental history can intersect with economic, cultural, transnational, intellectual, and political history, among other areas of interst. Our aim will be to better understand the field, its questions, its methodologies, and its relevance to seminar participants' own work.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
TENTATIVE:

W. Jeffrey Bolster, The Mortal Sea; ISBN 9780674047655


Peder Anker, Imperial Ecology; ISBN 9780674005952


Erik Loomis, Out Of Sight; ISBN 978-1620970089


Fredrik Jonsson, Enlightenment's Frontier; ISBN 978-0300162547


Kate Brown, Plutopia; ISBN 9780199855766


Gregory Cushman, Guano and the Opening of the Pacific World; ISBN 9781107655966


Kendra Smith-Howard, Pure And Modern Milk ISBN 9780199899128

subject: HISTORY
